page.title: 05MR CHAPPLE, HAMPSHIRE GAME
page.content: On the land near Redhouse Farm is a large metal barn owned by Mr Chapple which contains many large freezers.These hold great numbers of frozen game which are exported mainly to France and Belgium.There are 4 buildings on his five acres of land and Mr Chapple has lived here for 8 years.His part-time workers travel up to 50 miles to collect the game which comes from Dorset, Hampshire, Sussex,Somerset and Wiltshire.He freezes 100,000 pheasants and 20,000 rabbits and 3,000 deer in a normal year.A typical day is packing any dead game for export or freezing any new game which has been collected.The business is based in this area because the game is of good quality and plentiful. Their future plans are to expand on the same site with another large barn.
